lines.gurmukhi: piRQm hI iql boey DUir imil bUtu bwDY eyk sY Anyk hoq pRgt sMswr mY
lines.transliteration_english: Pridam Hee Til Boay Dhoori Mili Bootu Baadhai , Ayk Sai Anayk Hot Pragat Sansaar Mai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: A sesame seed is Sown that mixes with earth to become a plant. One seed gives several seeds and spreads in the world in many forms.

lines.gurmukhi: koaU lY cbwie koaU Kwl kwFY ryvrI kY koaU krY iqlvw imlwie gur bwr mY
lines.transliteration_english: Kooo Lai Chabaai Kooo Khaal Kaaddhai Rayvaree Kai , Kooo Karai Tilavaa Milaai Gur Baar Mai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Some munch them (sesame seeds), some coat sugar balls with them (Rewari) while others mix them with jaggery syrup and make cake/biscuit like eatables.

lines.gurmukhi: koaU auKlI fwir kUit iqlkut krY koaU kolU pIir dIp idpq AMiDAwr mY
lines.transliteration_english: Kooo Oukhalee Daari Kooti Tilakout Karai Kooo , Koloo Peeri Deep Dipat Andhiaar Mai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Some grind them and mix them with milk paste to make a form of sweet-meat, some squeeze them to extract oil and use it for burning lamp and lighting up their homes.

lines.gurmukhi: jw ky eyk iql ko bIcwru n khq AwvY Aibgiq giq kq Awvq bIcwr mY ]273]
lines.transliteration_english: Jaa Kay Ayk Til Ko Beechaaru N Kahat Aavai , Abigati Gati Kat Aavat Beechaar Mai ?273?

Shabad OS B.translation: When multiplicity of one sesame seed of the creator cannot be explained, how can the unknowable, formless Lord be known? (273)
